intro: Cyanea superba subsp. superba, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lanceolate, and often have a waxy coating. Cyanea superba subsp. superba is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the region.
